text.section: A husband may sue his wife on a contract made with her, as if she were unmarried.

section.section: A third person may maintain an action at law or in equity against a married woman in her married name.

text.section: If the rent is in arrears under a lease entered into with a married woman for a definite term or a term of years renewable forever, then, as if the woman were unmarried, the landlord may levy on goods under distress.

section.section: A depositary that returns to a married woman money she deposited before or during her marriage is validly discharged from any obligation concerning the money by a receipt from the woman.
If the deposit was made in fraud of the husband's creditors, a creditor of the husband may attach or, by injunction, restrain the payment of the money.
